definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: The fair value of the assets received or surrendered can be measured reliably.
sentences.chinese: 換入資產或換出資產的公允價值能夠可靠地計量。

sentences.english: This paper analyses the significance and influence of just value measurement.
sentences.chinese: 本文對公允價值計量的意義及影響加以庥析。

sentences.english: Chapter III: Analysis on the origin and application of Fair Value.
sentences.chinese: 第三章對公允價值進行理論探源和運用分析。

sentences.english: I won‘t argue with you, but I think you’re being unfair.
sentences.chinese: 我不和你爭論，不過我認爲你有失公允。

sentences.english: Sent to the police station, yue-hua zhang fair business deal with the problem.
sentences.chinese: 送到派出所，張躍華公允辦事處理了問題。

sentences.english: The traditional paper evaluation system is not fair to the staff.
sentences.chinese: 傳統的紙質測評方法對在職人員的測評有失公允。

sentences.english: This conclusion of assets evaluation is the reflection to the fair value of assets on the base date of assets evaluation.
sentences.chinese: 本評估結論系對評估基準日資產公允價值的反映。

sentences.english: Therefore, Yan-Jie's criticism on Lee-Yi is unfair.
sentences.chinese: 故嚴傑以此非李邕，有失公允。

sentences.english: This is unfair. Their measures are a restriction on China's development.
sentences.chinese: 這是有失公允的，實際上是限制中國的發展。

sentences.english: The company holds some trading value of evenhanded of sexual finance capital appears to drop considerably.
sentences.chinese: 公司持有的交易性金融資產公允價值出現大幅下降。

sentences.english: First, degree classification is unfair to some students.
sentences.chinese: 首先，學位分級對於一些學生來說是有失公允的。

definition: to cause a loss of (decorum, dignity etc) (used in fixed expressions)
